overview:
Bruno Pellegrini is one of the top Italian experts in digital media and social business, using his high level professional expertise and a unique vision of the media landscape to the objective of challenging existing business model. After graduating in business administration at the Bocconi University in Milan, he worked at Procter & Gamble and Bain & Co. He took his MBA at Insead, Paris, and joined Mediaset where he launched the internet portal Jumpy (Italy and Spain) and produced cross-media projects including the first edition of Big Brother.

In 2001 he co-founded Offside, a TV and feature film production company that won numerous international awards, including the Locarno Film Festival and David di Donatello, and produced the first national level UGC TV Show. In 2004 he founded the satellite channel, NessunoTV which broadcasted a full tv programming made with the contribution of a network of hundreds of videomakers.

He is currently CEO of TheBlogTV, a social media company he founded in 2006 which is leader in creating proprietary social platform (ie vertical social networks, crowdsourcing sites, cocreation projects, membership, consumer lab, social crm, etc.) for brands. TheBlogTV is also the owner of the satellite TV channel Babel (2010) and the video-crowdsourcing company Userfarm (2009).
